values:
Hi all,

Quick question for my f'list. :-) Would any of the Sirius/Harry artists I have added be interested in helping me create a header for my website in progress? I'm afraid the only payment I'd be able to offer would be my never ending gratitude and possibly a fic with a scenario of your choosing? 

Let me know through a comment on here or at my email: sirryaddict323@yahoo.com. 

♥ Thanks in advance, lovelies!

Andry

For those of you who haven't seen, LJ has finally made an official statement about the goings on of the past few days. You can find it here. I'm glad to see that they finally said something, but damn. It took them long enough!

Today was an absolutely amazing display of highs and lows. I can't shake the feeling of surrealiy that's settled over the day, and I don't know when this particular veil will lift, but for now, it's...calm. I'm calm. Life seems okay, but when I take a look under the surface...it's not. It's so...messy. Slippery. Sticky, like I mess I've forgotten to clean, but I know the pieces of this particular puzzle are still in the box and I'm staring down at the cover. My grandfather passed away last night. The night before last. Depending on how you look at time and whether or not your day starts with waking up or at midnight. It hasn't quite sunk in yet; he was my mother's father, and we might not have been the tightest or best of friends, but we were good. Things were...as fine as they were going to get. I saw him on my birthday, in March, and we smiled, we laughed, we joked. I showed him a bracelet I'd made and he said it was nice. He told me to do good and to behave, and I told him I loved him. Like I always do. The news arrived at noon today, and I knew it was bad, before I was told. I woke up uneasy, and the phone was ringing, and that's always bad. I sort of...gasped, I guess, and that's been the most I've reacted so far. In the shower, it struck me that he was gone, that he wasn't here anymore, and in a second, it was swept away by memories of my birthday and Christmas and phone coversations and fighting. My mother's a mess. My family is walking in a sort of daze, and I feel bad for laughing, for joking with my other grandfather, whom I live with, in the kitchen, brushing my hair and listening to techno on the radio. We had a retirement party to go to today, and there were laughs there, tears from my grandmother, from my mother, and a sort of quiet over my brother that I haven't seen since mom was in the hospital. I keep waiting for the shoe to fall, for my body and mind to react, but I can't and I feel bad. Life feels very odd, like an ill fitting glove, and I'm trying my best to simply fit; my ex and I were fighting last night and I snapped at him this morning, after learning the news about my grandfather, to leave me the fuck alone. I feel bad, but not really, because like Jenn said, it had to be done. He's been yanking me around on a chain for weeks now, trying to manipulate me into feeling what he wants me to feel, into being who he wants me to be, and I can't change, I refuse to. This is...well, it's my life, no matter how out of control it feels sometimes. I feel like two people at once right now, and while my thoughts are drifting from pillar to post, I have to wonder if either of them are very good at heart. It's...three, I think. I don't really know; the clocks in this house are all wrong and I'm too fucking lazy to try and find out what time it is. I know I'm tired, and I'm hungry, but I don't have the will to eat or sleep and I just want to curl up with fic and never move. But I'm like this a lot lately, so I doubt it's because of my grandfather's death. There's an ache in my shoulders that streches across my entire body and I can't shake it for the life of me. This...is turning out more depressing than I thought it would. Feel free to ignore this entirely. I just needed to talk at something, and this seemed like the best option. ♥

My thoughts and prayers go out to the people at Virginia Tech.


*hugs f'list*

Anyone on the f'list planning on staying up for another few hours? If any of you are, would any of you be interested in looking over chapter two of Heal Over, Someday for me? I've yet to find a permanent beta for it, so, for now, I'd love it if someone could take a looksie at it. I should be done typing it up within the hour here. Btw, sorry for the delay in posting. RL stuck its nose in, as it is wont to do, and I simply haven't had the time or the energy to do much of anything. But, things are settling down again and I've got more time to myself, and my brain seems to be functioning properly, hehe. I've got over ten pages of chapter two typed out and I'm sure I'll end up having something around thirteen or fifteen pages to hand over to whoever's interested in looking at it before I post it here and on FF.net So, anyone interested? :-) ♥Andry

Anyone on my f'list awake and willing to look through my completed prologue and chapter one for my Remus/Harry fic, Heal Over, Someday ? I'd love some feedback before I send it off to my beta. EDIT: All taken care of. :-D Hee, thanks ! ♥Andry

<font size="4" font color="purple">Happy Birthday, <lj user="sirryluv">!</font>

I hope today was full of joy and everything you wished it to be. :-) *hugs*

♥Andry

So, last week, at five in the freaking morning, I'm laying in bed, wide awake and scribbling down the complete plot to my Remus/Harry fic, Heal Over, Someday. I'd gotten a false start on this story about a month and a half ago, but since last week, I've gotten the plot completely written down (on four pieces of paper, front AND back). I started the prologue last night, have made a bit of progress on it, but am kicking the fic from here to hell and back because the prologue just set itself during wartime, and I wanted the story to be post-war. :-\ Hopefully chapter one will agree with me and make things easier. It's strange, how we're slaves to our stories. I figured I'd post a word meter for anyone who's interested in following the progress of my fic and for anyone who's waiting for the right time to volunteer to look it over/beta/give me advice, hehe. Below's the meter and the tenative story summary. Let me know if you guys are willing to help out and if anyone's interested in looking at it while it's still in progress. Summary: [Slash, Remus/Harry] Despair is a bitter thing and, although the War is over and his duty as hero is done, Harry Potter can't help but fall prey to the grasping emotion. Unable to shake the depression and the continuing cries of the Wizarding world, Harry needs someone to turn to. Enter Remus Lupin, who just might be able to help Harry in ways no one has ever been able to before.

1280 / 125000 words. 1% done! EDIT 02/23/07: Prologue finished! New word meter below. :-D

2009 / 125000 words. 2% done! EDIT 02/28/07: Chapter One finished! :-D New word meter below.

7469 / 125000 words. 6% done! EDIT 04/06/07 Chapter Two finished! :-D New word meter below.

13045 / 125000 words. 10% done! (I know, I know. I should be working on To One in Paradise or one of my other fics at ff.net, but, to tell you the truth, No Name Face is almost done, as it's being written as an RP. To One in Paradise simply refuses to sit still long enough, but I did have a major break through with the plot a few months ago, and I'm hoping to have chapters two and three out to you guys soon.) And RL? You slay me. *ded*

I'm honestly surprised at the f'list! Hehe, I haven't seen a single link to this particular photo yet. Jenn and I agree, he has a nice ass. IMAGE IN LINK NOT WORK SAFE. This is why I want to be in London at this very moment. Besides branching out into intriguing plays and such, it seems that Dan is taking on his new role rather well. I'm proud of him. He needed to take on a role like this, to get future roles lined up. Because he's not going to be Harry Potter forever, and it'd be a terrible waste to let him slip below the radar. :-D ♥Andry EDIT: All spelling mistakes were corrected. Hee. :-D EDIT 2: I just read several articles and interviews about and with this young man, and I think I've just fallen in love, lol. He seems to be an all around, down to earth person, which is surprising considering the fame he's gotten from being the Boy Wizard, Harry Potter. What's even better? He's still young (my age, to be exact, hehe) and has a long way to go. He's already established himself as an actor, is moving into theater acting, and seems to have a great life before him. I can't wait to see how this role in Equus leads to other things for him. I'm actually excited. :-D

lol, so I'm editing my journal style. I've changed it at least twenty times in the past half hour and it's still driving me nuts. I want to edit with HTML, but I haven't figured out which style is best for that. Any input from the f'list? ♥Andry (I apologize if I make your eyes burn with whatever style I'm on now, lol. *hugs!*) EDIT: I've settled on a style and color scheme. For now. :-D

Question for the f'list: Do any of you have Adult ADD/ADHD? Do any of your family members have it? Do any of your friends have it? And how many of you are familiar with it? I saw an article in a newspaper a few months back, and it's been plaguing me ever since. I'm often unfocused, restless, always starting projects and never finishing them; I'm quite often forgetful, and am prone to fits of hyperactivity. I have a history of anxiety and depression, and those are supposedly two key factors in the diagnosis of ADD/ADHD in people 17 and up. According to this article, ADD/ADHD is commonly diagnosed in children, but nearly 40% of adult patients are never diagnosed or treated for the condition. They often cast it off as living a stressful lifestyle, and subsequently go untreated. My life is anything but stressful (I'm a student, living with my grandparents, no job), and I'm seriously wondering if I should bring this up with my doctor. (I have full plans on mentioning it in future, but I'm curious as to whether others see this as a serious subject.) I've been treated in the past for depression, but most of the drugs I was put on weren't approved for teenagers at the time, and I almost always had to quit taking them because of severe mood swings and an even further fall into depression. I've climbed my way out of the worse syptoms, but I still suffer from a few--I refuse to go back on the medications for depression, though, because I did not enjoy the side-effects. I'm due to start counseling soon, but I'm not sure if a psychologist or psychiatrist is qualified to diagnos what could be Adult ADD/ADHD. So, um, any thoughts? I've been suffering from all of these symptoms for longer than six months, which seems to be the key time period in a diagnosis. I'm just wondering if there are any others out there who have experienced the same symptoms, etc. --Andry♥

+ + History Channel = see below LJ cut. This totally made my completely shitty day a thousand times better, and I apolgize if I'm spamming the f'list. But I had to share, because RL sucks. : LMAO History Channel. I'm watching The History of Sex: Ancient Civilizations, and they were talking about Mesopotamia and the narrator said: "Sex was their means of procreation." : Is there another way I'm not aware of? : ROFL : I'm not sure. Is there?? :-P : Did the Egyptians impregnate each other by staring hotly across a crowded room? : LOL : *giggles as she pictures it* : haha, flying sperm. *giggles and facepalms alternately* : *giggles uncontrollably* This is entirely Jenn's creation. I take no claim on it. And she says she has no talent for art. XD

:-) Um, with the New Years already having rolled around, I figured it might be time for me to re-introduce myself to some of my new friends, and reaquaint myself with the older ones. I've only used this journal for fandom before, so I'm hoping that I might be able to bring a bit of my every day life into the picture, too. But not much, because RL seriously needs to stay away sometimes. I'm Andry, and I was dubbed so by my very dear friend Larissa, lol. It's short for Alexandria. I've been in the HP fandom for nearing six years, and it's been one hell of a journey. I ship a lot of different pairs, including slash and het, and Harry's fair game for just about any one. I RP a lot, writing in offline stories with Jenn, another very dear friend, some of you know her as EnglishMuffin, and Larissa. The RPs are Sirry fics, and we actually want to post a few as soon as we finish one. *facepalm* We have several that we've been working on for nearly two and a half years, though, so don't get hopeful. Um, I'm a writer of Sirry, for the most part. Recently, I've branched off into writing Remus/Harry, too, and have one chaptered fic in the works, and one oneshot I'm hoping to post within the next couple of the days. As for the Sirry fics...I currently have one in progress fic, To One in Paradise, and a ton of others on hiatus. There never seems to be enough time in the day to get any work done on any of them. *sighs* But, I'll read almost anything, and I really hope you enjoy what I do post, when I can. :-D I love helping out people in various comms, so don't hesitate to ask if you need help finding a fic, finding a site, etc. I'd love to help!

Harry was concerned, wary even. Maybe even a little bit confused. Because Sirius was being quiet. Eyeing the man as he squeezed the extra water from the rag in his hands into the bowl next to his knees, Harry decided that maybe the silence he'd been wanting from the man all evening wasn't as good a thing he thought. Surely his wishes for the man's embarrassing questions to end hadn't been granted and had taken away conversational skills as well? Sirius was on the other side of the room, standing on top of a stool as he used both magic and physical effort to clean the tank that was a foot and a half taller than he was; he'd removed his teaching robe in favor of his t-shirt and trousers, and Harry was only being honest when he mentally noted that the view was pretty nice. Strong back, flexing arms, taut thighs as he stretched over the rim of the tank to scrub grime away. Harry wiped a trickle of sweat from his temple with his wrist, and he leaned down, almost against the ground, as he scrubbed away a brown spot on the glass that looked suspiciously like blood. "Sirius?" He didn't know if it was the effort of scrubbing or the sudden nervousness in his belly that made his voice a little bit breathless, but he wasn't going to linger on the thought too long; thinking lead to answers he wasn't sure he wanted at the moment. Cursing as the spot he'd been scrubbing failed to allow itself to be cleaned, Sirius replied with a gruff, "Yeah?" Harry scratched at the stain with a nail, trying not to grimace as the feeling reminded him of pulling his nails down a chalkboard. "You okay? You got really quiet all of a sudden..." Not looking at Harry as he worked, Sirius leaned forward on the edge of the glass, arm straining to reach the edge of a grimy spot below him. "I'm," he paused, an 'oof' of air being released as he settled back onto the stool, "fine. Just hoping Moony wasn't serious about attatching one of these to my tail." His voice was slightly strained as he answered, and Harry looked up to make sure everything was all right. Apparently, it wasn't, because Sirius was leaning against the edge of the tank, elbows hooked around the top as he stood on his tiptoes to tap his wand to the darkened glass. His muscles were visibly shaking against the strain, but Sirius was oblivious; the repeated low muttering of a spell was on the edge of Harry's hearing. The patch of glass he'd been rubbing at was finally coming clean, and Harry rinsed the rag in the bowl again, water darkening to a putrid shade of mauve. "If you know what, exactly, we're cleaning off, I'd prefer it if you'd kept it to yourself." Sirius' strained chuckled echoed in the tank filled room, and another sigh of air escaping his chest as he stood fully on the stool again, weight centering with ease. "Nah, I don't know, but if I were you, I'd be a bit more concerned with what made the stain." They grew quiet again, Sirius' low mutters the only thing accompanying the occasional creak from the castle. Harry didn't look up when Sirius audbly plopped down from the stool, but he did look up when the man spoke his name in a soft tone that was often unheard. "You do know that I'm not being mean with you about your problem of the moment, don't you?" Sirius was partially facing him now, frown creasing his brow as he worked on the surface before him. Harry smiled, the truth mildly irritating, but only because he was embarrassed by some of the things Sirius had asked. "Yeah, I know." "I can't say that I'm sorry about the interrigation, though, y'know? You're drugged and I'm naturally curious." Laughing, Harry tapped the edge of the bowl with his wand and cleared out the grime, summoning fresh water. "About what?" Sirius shrugged, the motion a fluid rolling of his shoulders. "Things, I guess. Like why you didn't make a move on Tonks." Blinking, Harry replied without hesitation, "I didn't want to. I had...someone else on my mind at the time, and she was sort of a fill-in, if you know what I mean." "I understand." And Sirius sounded like he really did; the man was often quirky, flirty, and all smiles, but there was the rare occasion when he was actually serious and thoughtful. Harry wondered if it'd really be okay to share these kinds of things with Sirius; sure, they knew each other like the backs of their hands, and got under one another's skin constantly, but there were certain times when they became unreadable, separate. Would it be all right if they took away some of those distinctions? He pushed aside the thought of, maybe this truth stuff isn't all that bad, and asked Sirius slowly, "So. Anything in particular you want to know? Because I'm telling the truth and am giving you the opportunity to exploit it." Sirius looked at him then, eyes unreadable, and didn't say anything for a moment. His eyes slid away slowly, as if testing, and he repeated, "Anything I want to know?" Harry nodded, trusting the man to be tactful this time around. "Anything." He was surprised by the silence that followed, fully expecting his godfather to start an immediate interrigation about something inane and useless. Going back to his scrubbing, Harry almost missed the quiet question that floated over from the other end of the room. "How often do you lie, Harry?" Taking a moment to think about that one, Harry searched for the truth and slowly cleaned as he thought. "Not often. Just when I have to." There was a low uttering of a cleaning spell before Sirius' next question. "What do you lie about? I've never really been able to tell when you're lying, and when you're not." Harry paused, scratched at a stain and spoke softly. "I lie when someone asks about my time with the Dursley's; when they ask if I remember anything about the time just after I defeated Voldemort. I've lied to Remus when he's asked if I need any help because it's usually just after the full moon and he looks like hell but wants to do something. Everyday white lies when the students ask if they look all right and if I think their boyfriend or girlfriend will like what they bought them for Christmas...Things like that." He flicked a piece of dirt of his nail and looked up at Sirius, who was cleaning the same spot he had been five minutes ago. "I've never lied when it comes to the really important things, if that's what you want to know, Sirius." Sirius' eyes met his, and Harry couldn't blame the sudden jumping sensation in his chest on being startled. "And what's important?" "You," the first word was spoken with the most signifigance. "Hermione, Ron, Remus. My students. Being here when I know damn well that I shouldn't." When Sirius opened his mouth to tell him that that wasn't true, Harry fixed him with a look. The man visibly changed his answer and replied with, "You know how much I hate it that you think that." "I do." "So why do you still feel that way?" Harry pushed himself up from his crouched position on the ground and stretched. "Because it's true. But you can stop worrying about it, because, like I said, being here is important to me." He dropped his arms from his stretch and watched his godfather go through the motions of scrubbing and cleaning. He was avoiding looking at Harry, and the young man knew this behaviour quite well; Sirius was convincing himself that everything was all right in the world, that Harry was happy and was content with the life he'd settled for. The man'd always get like this after they'd touched on sensitive topics; Harry restrained the urge to go and hold the man. Sirius bit his lip repeatedly, cogs turning, and Harry had just turned away when he asked in his quiet voice again, "How often do you lie to me, Harry?" For some reason, although he knew the answer immediately, Harry paused. He refused to turn around, not wanting to see the dissapointment on the man's face when he confessed this piece of information. "I've...only truly lied to you once. One time, Sirius, and I really shouldn't have in the first place." Harry wasn't sure if he could physically force himself to tell Sirius the truth if he asked it of him. He wasn't sure if he'd be able to hand the man such a hurtful answer without turning away from himself in disgust. There was a night when Harry had needed Sirius; needed him to take care of him, take over so Harry could sit back and look at the fragments of his life that were slowly scattering in the breeze. And he'd turned him away, locked the door and refused to open as he ran in the other direction; he'd sought the comfort of Remus' calm voice and soothing teas, and hadn't answered when Sirius asked him if he'd been okay. He'd had a nightmare, the dry-screaming kind that leaves every inch of your body on fire for hours after waking; Sirius had been dying, dying by Harry's hands as the young man became both the killer and the observer and there was nothing he could do about it. It had been a real fear, something he hated to think about and grew physically ill when reminded of: he was a killer. And anyone could be his victim. Anything was possible, and there was a possibility that he might become just like Voldemort as the power and magic took over everything he knew and swallowed him whole. But he should admit to it, anyway. His stomach curled in on itself momentarily, the feeling of saying something of great value; Sirius deserved to know. "I lied to you that night I told you I didn't need you." He didn't wait for Sirius' response, because as sudden as the revelation within Harry was, and old longing rose inside of him; he'd felt like this forever, and when being completely honest, he was quite tired of keeping it inside. The door to the room was shutting behind him before he had the chance to fully comprehend his unstable emotional core; the stones on the hall wall were cold against Harry's back, and he stood beside the door for just a moment. Sirius didn't come after him. And Harry realized he was completely, desperately, irritatingly in love.
*
Harry had, by now, mastered the art of sitting cross-legged on his broom. It was a thing of balance really, and as long as you locked your ankles properly, you were relatively safe; sudden gusts of wind were your only enemy. It was quiet above the Quidditch pitch, students long having trooped off to bed rather than face the wrath of vacation seeking teachers; there was a month until exams, and everyone was starting to feel the stress. Including Harry. He'd had his third dose of Veritaserum that morning, and as the day progressed, an uncomfortable sensation was growing in his stomach; a premonition of something that was of great importance. It wasn't the first time he'd felt it, he'd been feeling it since the evening he and Sirius had been cleaning the tanks out for Remus, but tonight, it had progressed past the minor sensation that curled in his abdomen to a distracting lump. Harry Potter was a teacher and a killer. He'd been a friend and a liar, and had cushioned his world with white lies and black, convincing himself that the little things that Sirius did only annoyed him because the man was so predictable. But that wasn't the truth. He'd slowly but surely been falling under Sirius' spell, his quick-fire grins and barking laughter rolling across Harry's nerves like ice on sunburned skin; a deliciously satisfying sensation that hurt at the same time. Harry didn't want this: didn't want to be in love with the one person who could seriously hurt him and damage him beyond repair; didn't want to feel the ache in his chest as he wrapped himself in cloudy denial. What had started as a minor situation about his health had led to startling revelations, the tearing away of his veiled comfort, and a rift between he and Sirius that had yet to repair. In a week and a half, Harry had felt as though his world had been torn down, rebuilt, and installed with a new set of rules. They hadn't spoken since that evening; Harry had avoided Sirius at all costs and bit the insides of his cheeks every time Remus or someone else spoke on the subject that was obviously stressing them both. Sirius was confused, pained eyes looking at him from across whatever room they may be in at the time, and Harry couldn't bring himself to cross the carpet to stand beside his godfather, because he was in love. His stomach tightened in knots and as he repeated to himself softly that he wasn't meaning to be hurtful to Sirius, he tried to remember why everything felt so...out of sorts. He was scattered, thoughts in a million directions as the Veritaserum coursed through his system. He felt sick, stomach rolling, hands clammy, head throbbing as it tried to piece together what the hell was going on. He was in love. He was suddenly and abruptly avoiding Sirius. He was most likely hurting the man. He wanted so desperately to be inside and arguing with Sirius, because fighting meant normality, and normality meant purpose. Harry couldn't do this for much longer.
*
Harry could feel the eyes on the back of his neck as he made his way through the halls back to his rooms, but he didn't pause or look back once.

Title: Smiles and Sunshine Kisses Rating: T Fandom: Harry Potter Character(s)/Pairing(s): Sirius/Harry, kind of. Sirius had been scared the first time it had happened, truly and honestly scared. He'd been in a dreamless sleep, relaxed and sated after an evening spent talking, and drinking, with Remus; later, when he sat back to observe what had happened, he cursed himself for not having seen it sooner. Nightmares. Nightmares that curled behind the emerald surface of Harry's eyes; dreams that itched deep inside his chest. The screaming woke him first; the horrid, bone-chilling screams that Sirius hadn't heard in months; the sound curled into him with a paralyzing agent, icy bands contracting around his wrists and ankles as his heart stopped and jump started in a staccato rhythm. It took a few moments for him to swallow, to shake his head against the fear and move past being an observer to his reality. The screams drove into him like a thousand splinters that lit every one of his nerves on fire. It took him even longer to tiptoe around his bedroom, gathering his clothes before making his way to Harry's room, where the nightmare was intensifying, if the sounds behind the door were any indication. The muttered litany of, "No, no, no, no, no!" curled around his wrist and twisted the knob; Harry's fear was pooling beneath Sirius' skin in a cold sweat that slid against his skin in clammy comfort. Harry's pain was evident in the closed fist grip upon the sheets, bare chest heaving for air as he unconsciously bit back another round of screaming; Sirius' body slid into a protective mode it hadn't seen for a while, and seemed to work without his permission. It recognized this phantom horror and sought to remove it on its own accord; he knelt on the bed, half across Harry, and lifted the thrashing head with gentle, calloused fingers. He was kissing tears away before it had a chance to register; open mouthed whispers that sought the emotional pain and drew it out like a salve. He was crying as Harry stilled, hands fighting his gentle hold for just a moment before surrendering and curling into Sirius' hair with a sob. The grip was harsh, fingers clenching in half-awake dreams, but Sirius pressed forward, slipping kisses into matted hair, onto tear stained eyes. When Harry woke completely, it was to curl his body into Sirius' frame, to pull him down, weight keeping him from the pain as it had so many months before. Harry's head was cradled in the space between Sirius' arms, and a dry mouth pressed kisses to a wet jaw, and they both were crying as Sirius slid down Harry's body to press his face into the hollow below his ribs, hands pressing against Harry's collar; neither was sure who needed the comfort, but both were willing to give. They laid in the position that represented a time that they had been at last safe, and it scared Sirius because he shouldn't have remembered every last detail from those hours. But Harry was crying again, hands tracing the scars, inside and out, with shaking hands that spoke of love, and Sirius pressed a kiss to a bare stomach that whispered the, "I'm sorry, so sorry...so, so, so sorry," that threatened to escape. I do not own Harry Potter, any of the characters involved, and I am not making any profit from this work of fanfiction.

Title: Smiles and Sunshine Kisses Rating: T Fandom: Harry Potter Character(s)/Pairing(s): Sirius/Harry, in a way. The first touches weren't hesitant; they were controlled, soft, gentle movements of curling fingers tracing fading scars. They were movements that both sets of hands knew well; patterns from the care of treating War wounds that were ingrained in the very fibers of their skin. The pair would be sitting on their couch, in their home, alone after an afternoon with Remus and Hermione, when fingers would slide across a wrist, tracing the edge of a burn that was in the final stage of healing. Depending on the person who was touching, the path would change; if it was Sirius, his fingers would trail up silky flesh to rest in the soft curve of a scarred stab wound on Harry's forearm. If it was Harry, the fingers would dip and swirl, tracing the calloused-over lines of physical defense wounds on Sirius' palms. They'd slide into an embrace that had long overstepped the boundaries of platonic, but had never crossed the line of physical romance. Harry would curl into Sirius' lap, knees folding beneath him as he bowed his head beneath Sirius' chin in what looked like a mockery of childlike innocence. Sirius would pause for a moment, nose resting against Harry's temple, and inhale deeply; coarse fingertips would slide compliant arms onto Sirius' shoulders', and he'd curl inwards, drawing Harry to him with a soft sigh. Harry would fall asleep then, resting comfortably and without nightmares; his soft weight would often lull Sirius into a hazy state that was familiar. He'd draw Harry closer to him then, fingers rubbing slow circles into the line of the young man's spine, tips of his nails grazing along the line of skin between trousers and T-shirt. Harry would arc forward, Sirius would inhale deeply, and he'd smooth the wrinkled fabric beneath his hands. Waking to a jerking motion, as his world slid backward momentarily, Harry would groan as Sirius slipped his elbows beneath his numbing knees, and he'd press closer. This was when the line between platonic and romantic would blur, but neither of them really paid attention; a soft kiss would be pressed to a drowsy mouth, whispered goodnights curling from a throat that so desperately wanted to say, "I love you." The first touches weren't hesitant, the embrace that followed was always safe, but the last words of the evening coiled inside like a sickening combination of hope and fear; minds working on basic instinct as thought was brushed away, they were unsure. But the lines between platonic and romantic were blurred, and it was decided that it didn't really matter. I do not own Harry Potter or any of the characters involved, and I am not making any profit from this work of fanfiction.
